line1: There was a wise farmer named Stan
line2: Who managed a small farm on his land.
line3: When a storm hits his stock,
line5: But he does not panic in his plan.

line1: There was a greedy man named Loland
line2: Who made a great fortune on his land.
line5: So they went up and slept on the stand.

line1: There was a honest man named Dwight
line2: Who lost all his money in a fight.
line5: And they did not like feeling of spite.

line1: A mouse in her room woke Miss Dowd
line2: She was frightened--it must be allowed.
line3: Soon a happy thought hit her --
line5: She sat up in bed and meowed.

line1: There was a young woman named Kite,
line2: Whose speed was much faster than light,
line5: And returned on the previous night.

line1: There was a skinny boy named Fred
line2: Who carried a big bag on his head.
line3: With his hands on the hips,
line4: With his eyes and his lips,
line5: He was ready to give and to lead.

line1: There was a young lady of Cork,
line2: Whose Pa made a fortune in pork;
line5: To balance green peas on her fork.

line1: There was a dear lady of Eden,
line2: Who on apples was quite fond of feeding;
line5: And then both skedaddled from Eden.

line1: A silly young man from Clyde
line2: In a funeral procession was spied;
line5: "I don't know; I just came for the ride."
